  1866|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  1867|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  1868|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class CallWrapper:
  1869|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """Internal class. Stores function to call when some user
  1870|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    defined Tcl function is called e.g. after an event occurred."""
  1871|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  1950|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  1951|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The first form returns a list of the platform specific flags and
  1952|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        their values. The second form returns the value for the specific
  1953|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        option. The third form sets one or more of the values. The values
  1954|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        are as follows:
  1955|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  1956|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        On Windows, -disabled gets or sets whether the window is in a
  1957|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        disabled state. -toolwindow gets or sets the style of the window
  1958|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        to toolwindow (as defined in the MSDN). -topmost gets or sets
  1959|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        whether this is a topmost window (displays above all other

  1961|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  1965|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """

  2095|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def wm_iconphoto(self, default=False, *args): # new in Tk 8.5
  2096|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Sets the titlebar icon for this window based on the named photo
  2097|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        images passed through args. If default is True, this is applied to
  2098|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        all future created toplevels as well.
  2099|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2100|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The data in the images is taken as a snapshot at the time of
  2101|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        invocation. If the images are later changed, this is not reflected
  2102|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        to the titlebar icons. Multiple images are accepted to allow
  2103|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        different images sizes to be provided. The window manager may scale
  2104|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        provided icons to an appropriate size.
  2105|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2106|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        On Windows, the images are packed into a Windows icon structure.
  2107|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        This will override an icon specified to wm_iconbitmap, and vice
  2108|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        versa.
  2109|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2110|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        On X, the images are arranged into the _NET_WM_ICON X property,
  2111|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        which most modern window managers support. An icon specified by
  2112|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        wm_iconbitmap may exist simultaneously.
  2113|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2114|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        On Macintosh, this currently does nothing."""
  2115|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if default:
  2116|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call('wm', 'iconphoto', self._w, "-default", *args)
  2117|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        else:
  2118|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call('wm', 'iconphoto', self._w, *args)
  2119|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2120|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    iconphoto = wm_iconphoto

  2331|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def report_callback_exception(self, exc, val, tb):
  2332|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Report callback exception on sys.stderr.
  2333|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2334|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Applications may want to override this internal function, and
  2335|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        should when sys.stderr is None."""
  2336|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        import traceback
  2337|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        print("Exception in Tkinter callback", file=sys.stderr)
  2338|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        sys.last_type = exc
  2339|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        sys.last_value = val
  2340|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        sys.last_traceback = tb
  2341|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        traceback.print_exception(exc, val, tb)
  2342|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2343|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __getattr__(self, attr):
  2344|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        "Delegate attribute access to the interpreter object"
  2345|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return getattr(self.tk, attr)
  2346|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2347|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# Ideally, the classes Pack, Place and Grid disappear, the
  2348|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# pack/place/grid methods are defined on the Widget class, and
  2349|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# everybody uses w.pack_whatever(...) instead of Pack.whatever(w,
  2350|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# ...), with pack(), place() and grid() being short for
  2351|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# pack_configure(), place_configure() and grid_columnconfigure(), and
  2352|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# forget() being short for pack_forget().  As a practical matter, I'm
  2353|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# afraid that there is too much code out there that may be using the
  2354|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# Pack, Place or Grid class, so I leave them intact -- but only as
  2355|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# backwards compatibility features.  Also note that those methods that
  2356|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# take a master as argument (e.g. pack_propagate) have been moved to
  2357|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# the Misc class (which now incorporates all methods common between
  2358|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# toplevel and interior widgets).  Again, for compatibility, these are
  2359|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# copied into the Pack, Place or Grid class.
  2360|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2361|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2362|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|def Tcl(screenName=None, baseName=None, className='Tk', useTk=0):
  2363|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    return Tk(screenName, baseName, className, useTk)
  2364|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2365|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2366|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class Pack:
  2367|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """Geometry manager Pack.
  2368|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2369|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    Base class to use the methods pack_* in every widget."""
  2370|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2371|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def pack_configure(self, cnf={}, **kw):
  2372|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Pack a widget in the parent widget. Use as options:
  2373|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        after=widget - pack it after you have packed widget
  2374|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        anchor=NSEW (or subset) - position widget according to
  2375|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                                  given direction
  2376|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        before=widget - pack it before you will pack widget
  2377|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        expand=bool - expand widget if parent size grows
  2378|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        fill=NONE or X or Y or BOTH - fill widget if widget grows
  2379|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        in=master - use master to contain this widget
  2380|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        in_=master - see 'in' option description
  2381|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        ipadx=amount - add internal padding in x direction
  2382|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        ipady=amount - add internal padding in y direction
  2383|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        padx=amount - add padding in x direction
  2384|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        pady=amount - add padding in y direction
  2385|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        side=TOP or BOTTOM or LEFT or RIGHT -  where to add this widget.
  2386|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  2387|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(
  2388|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|              ('pack', 'configure', self._w)
  2389|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|              + self._options(cnf, kw))
  2390|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2391|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    pack = configure = config = pack_configure
  2392|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2393|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def pack_forget(self):
  2394|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Unmap this widget and do not use it for the packing order."""
  2395|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call('pack', 'forget', self._w)
  2396|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2397|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    forget = pack_forget
  2398|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2399|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def pack_info(self):
  2400|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return information about the packing options
  2401|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        for this widget."""
  2402|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        d = _splitdict(self.tk, self.tk.call('pack', 'info', self._w))
  2403|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if 'in' in d:
  2404|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            d['in'] = self.nametowidget(d['in'])
  2405|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return d
  2406|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2407|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    info = pack_info

  2409|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    slaves = pack_slaves = Misc.pack_slaves

  2417|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def place_configure(self, cnf={}, **kw):
  2418|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Place a widget in the parent widget. Use as options:
  2419|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        in=master - master relative to which the widget is placed
  2420|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        in_=master - see 'in' option description
  2421|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        x=amount - locate anchor of this widget at position x of master
  2422|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        y=amount - locate anchor of this widget at position y of master
  2423|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        relx=amount - locate anchor of this widget between 0.0 and 1.0
  2424|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                      relative to width of master (1.0 is right edge)
  2425|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        rely=amount - locate anchor of this widget between 0.0 and 1.0
  2426|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                      relative to height of master (1.0 is bottom edge)
  2427|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        anchor=NSEW (or subset) - position anchor according to given direction
  2428|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        width=amount - width of this widget in pixel
  2429|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        height=amount - height of this widget in pixel
  2430|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        relwidth=amount - width of this widget between 0.0 and 1.0
  2431|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                          relative to width of master (1.0 is the same width
  2432|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                          as the master)
  2433|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        relheight=amount - height of this widget between 0.0 and 1.0
  2434|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                           relative to height of master (1.0 is the same
  2435|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                           height as the master)
  2436|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        bordermode="inside" or "outside" - whether to take border width of
  2437|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                                           master widget into account
  2438|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  2439|        22|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(
  2440|        22|            0|            0|  0.00%|              ('place', 'configure', self._w)
  2441|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|              + self._options(cnf, kw))

  2470|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Position a widget in the parent widget in a grid. Use as options:
  2471|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        column=number - use cell identified with given column (starting with 0)
  2472|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        columnspan=number - this widget will span several columns
  2473|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        in=master - use master to contain this widget

  2478|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        pady=amount - add padding in y direction
  2479|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        row=number - use cell identified with given row (starting with 0)
  2480|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        rowspan=number - this widget will span several rows
  2481|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        sticky=NSEW - if cell is larger on which sides will this
  2482|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                      widget stick to the cell boundary
  2483|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  2484|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(
  2485|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|              ('grid', 'configure', self._w)

  2533|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            name = cnf['name']
  2534|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            del cnf['name']
  2535|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if not name:
  2536|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|            name = self.__class__.__name__.lower()
  2537|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if master._last_child_ids is None:

  2539|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|            count = master._last_child_ids.get(name, 0) + 1
  2540|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|            master._last_child_ids[name] = count
  2541|        11|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if count == 1:
  2542|         5|            0|            0|  0.00%|                name = '!%s' % (name,)
  2543|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            else:
  2544|         6|            0|            0|  0.00%|                name = '!%s%d' % (name, count)

  2548|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        else:

  2593|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class Toplevel(BaseWidget, Wm):
  2594|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """Toplevel widget, e.g. for dialogs."""
  2595|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2596|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, master=None, cnf={}, **kw):
  2597|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Construct a toplevel widget with the parent MASTER.
  2598|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2599|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class,
  2600|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground,
  2601|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        highlightcolor, highlightthickness, menu, relief, screen, takefocus,
  2602|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        use, visual, width."""
  2603|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if kw:
  2604|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            cnf = _cnfmerge((cnf, kw))
  2605|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        extra = ()
  2606|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        for wmkey in ['screen', 'class_', 'class', 'visual',
  2607|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                  'colormap']:
  2608|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if wmkey in cnf:
  2609|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                val = cnf[wmkey]
  2610|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                # TBD: a hack needed because some keys
  2611|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                # are not valid as keyword arguments
  2612|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                if wmkey[-1] == '_': opt = '-'+wmkey[:-1]
  2613|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                else: opt = '-'+wmkey
  2614|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                extra = extra + (opt, val)
  2615|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                del cnf[wmkey]
  2616|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        BaseWidget.__init__(self, master, 'toplevel', cnf, {}, extra)
  2617|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        root = self._root()
  2618|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.iconname(root.iconname())
  2619|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.title(root.title())
  2620|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.protocol("WM_DELETE_WINDOW", self.destroy)

  2649|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2650|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        This is accomplished by redisplaying
  2651|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the button several times, alternating between active and
  2652|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        normal colors. At the end of the flash the button is left

  2730|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        function identified with FUNCID."""

  2736|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Bind to all items with TAGORID at event SEQUENCE a call to function FUNC.
  2737|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  2738|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        An additional boolean parameter ADD specifies whether FUNC will be
  2739|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        called additionally to the other bound function or whether it will
  2740|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        replace the previous function. See bind for the return value."""
  2741|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._bind((self._w, 'bind', tagOrId),

  3104|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3105|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, master=None, cnf={}, **kw):
  3106|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Construct a frame widget with the parent MASTER.
  3107|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3108|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Valid resource names: background, bd, bg, borderwidth, class,
  3109|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        colormap, container, cursor, height, highlightbackground,
  3110|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        highlightcolor, highlightthickness, relief, takefocus, visual, width."""
  3111|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        cnf = _cnfmerge((cnf, kw))
  3112|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        extra = ()
  3113|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if 'class_' in cnf:
  3114|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            extra = ('-class', cnf['class_'])
  3115|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            del cnf['class_']
  3116|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        elif 'class' in cnf:

  3118|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            del cnf['class']

  3332|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def delete(self, index1, index2=None):
  3333|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Delete menu items between INDEX1 and INDEX2 (included)."""
  3334|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if index2 is None:
  3335|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            index2 = index1
  3336|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3337|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        num_index1, num_index2 = self.index(index1), self.index(index2)
  3338|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if (num_index1 is None) or (num_index2 is None):
  3339|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            num_index1, num_index2 = 0, -1
  3340|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3341|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        for i in range(num_index1, num_index2 + 1):
  3342|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if 'command' in self.entryconfig(i):
  3343|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                c = str(self.entrycget(i, 'command'))
  3344|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                if c:
  3345|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                    self.deletecommand(c)
  3346|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(self._w, 'delete', index1, index2)
  3347|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3556|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def bbox(self, index):
  3557|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return a tuple of (x,y,width,height) which gives the bounding
  3558|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        box of the visible part of the character at the given index."""
  3559|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(
  3560|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                self.tk.call(self._w, 'bbox', index)) or None
  3561|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3562|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def compare(self, index1, op, index2):
  3563|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return whether between index INDEX1 and index INDEX2 the
  3564|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        relation OP is satisfied. OP is one of <, <=, ==, >=, >, or !=."""
  3565|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.getboolean(self.tk.call(
  3566|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self._w, 'compare', index1, op, index2))
  3567|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3568|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def count(self, index1, index2, *args): # new in Tk 8.5
  3569|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Counts the number of relevant things between the two indices.
  3570|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If index1 is after index2, the result will be a negative number
  3571|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        (and this holds for each of the possible options).
  3572|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3573|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The actual items which are counted depends on the options given by
  3574|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args. The result is a list of integers, one for the result of each
  3575|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        counting option given. Valid counting options are "chars",
  3576|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        "displaychars", "displayindices", "displaylines", "indices",
  3577|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        "lines", "xpixels" and "ypixels". There is an additional possible
  3578|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        option "update", which if given then all subsequent options ensure
  3579|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        that any possible out of date information is recalculated."""
  3580|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args = ['-%s' % arg for arg in args if not arg.startswith('-')]
  3581|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args += [index1, index2]
  3582|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        res = self.tk.call(self._w, 'count', *args) or None
  3583|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if res is not None and len(args) <= 3:
  3584|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return (res, )
  3585|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        else:
  3586|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return res
  3587|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3588|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def debug(self, boolean=None):
  3589|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Turn on the internal consistency checks of the B-Tree inside the text
  3590|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        widget according to BOOLEAN."""
  3591|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if boolean is None:
  3592|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return self.tk.getboolean(self.tk.call(self._w, 'debug'))
  3593|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(self._w, 'debug', boolean)
  3594|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3595|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def delete(self, index1, index2=None):
  3596|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Delete the characters between INDEX1 and INDEX2 (not included)."""
  3597|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(self._w, 'delete', index1, index2)
  3598|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3599|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def dlineinfo(self, index):
  3600|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return tuple (x,y,width,height,baseline) giving the bounding box
  3601|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        and baseline position of the visible part of the line containing
  3602|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the character at INDEX."""
  3603|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(self.tk.call(self._w, 'dlineinfo', index))
  3604|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3605|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def dump(self, index1, index2=None, command=None, **kw):
  3606|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return the contents of the widget between index1 and index2.
  3607|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3608|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The type of contents returned in filtered based on the keyword
  3609|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        parameters; if 'all', 'image', 'mark', 'tag', 'text', or 'window' are
  3610|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        given and true, then the corresponding items are returned. The result
  3611|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        is a list of triples of the form (key, value, index). If none of the
  3612|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        keywords are true then 'all' is used by default.
  3613|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3614|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If the 'command' argument is given, it is called once for each element
  3615|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        of the list of triples, with the values of each triple serving as the
  3616|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        arguments to the function. In this case the list is not returned."""
  3617|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args = []
  3618|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        func_name = None
  3619|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        result = None
  3620|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if not command:
  3621|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            # Never call the dump command without the -command flag, since the
  3622|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            # output could involve Tcl quoting and would be a pain to parse
  3623|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            # right. Instead just set the command to build a list of triples
  3624|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            # as if we had done the parsing.
  3625|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            result = []
  3626|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            def append_triple(key, value, index, result=result):
  3627|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                result.append((key, value, index))
  3628|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            command = append_triple
  3629|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        try:
  3630|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if not isinstance(command, str):
  3631|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                func_name = command = self._register(command)
  3632|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            args += ["-command", command]
  3633|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            for key in kw:
  3634|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                if kw[key]: args.append("-" + key)
  3635|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            args.append(index1)
  3636|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if index2:
  3637|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                args.append(index2)
  3638|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call(self._w, "dump", *args)
  3639|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return result
  3640|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        finally:
  3641|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if func_name:
  3642|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                self.deletecommand(func_name)
  3643|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3644|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    ## new in tk8.4
  3645|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit(self, *args):
  3646|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Internal method
  3647|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3648|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        This method controls the undo mechanism and
  3649|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the modified flag. The exact behavior of the
  3650|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        command depends on the option argument that
  3651|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        follows the edit argument. The following forms
  3652|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        of the command are currently supported:
  3653|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3654|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        edit_modified, edit_redo, edit_reset, edit_separator
  3655|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        and edit_undo
  3656|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3657|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3658|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, 'edit', *args)
  3659|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3660|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit_modified(self, arg=None):
  3661|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Get or Set the modified flag
  3662|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3663|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If arg is not specified, returns the modified
  3664|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        flag of the widget. The insert, delete, edit undo and
  3665|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        edit redo commands or the user can set or clear the
  3666|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        modified flag. If boolean is specified, sets the
  3667|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        modified flag of the widget to arg.
  3668|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3669|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.edit("modified", arg)
  3670|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3671|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit_redo(self):
  3672|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Redo the last undone edit
  3673|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3674|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        When the undo option is true, reapplies the last
  3675|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        undone edits provided no other edits were done since
  3676|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        then. Generates an error when the redo stack is empty.
  3677|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Does nothing when the undo option is false.
  3678|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3679|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.edit("redo")
  3680|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3681|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit_reset(self):
  3682|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Clears the undo and redo stacks
  3683|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3684|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.edit("reset")
  3685|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3686|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit_separator(self):
  3687|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Inserts a separator (boundary) on the undo stack.
  3688|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3689|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Does nothing when the undo option is false
  3690|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3691|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.edit("separator")
  3692|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3693|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def edit_undo(self):
  3694|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Undoes the last edit action
  3695|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3696|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If the undo option is true. An edit action is defined
  3697|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        as all the insert and delete commands that are recorded
  3698|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        on the undo stack in between two separators. Generates
  3699|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        an error when the undo stack is empty. Does nothing
  3700|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        when the undo option is false
  3701|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  3702|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.edit("undo")
  3703|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3704|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def get(self, index1, index2=None):
  3705|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return the text from INDEX1 to INDEX2 (not included)."""
  3706|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, 'get', index1, index2)
  3707|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    # (Image commands are new in 8.0)

  3709|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def image_cget(self, index, option):
  3710|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return the value of OPTION of an embedded image at INDEX."""
  3711|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if option[:1] != "-":
  3712|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            option = "-" + option
  3713|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if option[-1:] == "_":
  3714|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            option = option[:-1]
  3715|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, "image", "cget", index, option)
  3716|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3797|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3798|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def search(self, pattern, index, stopindex=None,
  3799|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|           forwards=None, backwards=None, exact=None,
  3800|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|           regexp=None, nocase=None, count=None, elide=None):
  3801|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Search PATTERN beginning from INDEX until STOPINDEX.
  3802|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Return the index of the first character of a match or an
  3803|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        empty string."""
  3804|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args = [self._w, 'search']
  3805|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if forwards: args.append('-forwards')
  3806|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if backwards: args.append('-backwards')
  3807|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if exact: args.append('-exact')
  3808|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if regexp: args.append('-regexp')
  3809|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if nocase: args.append('-nocase')
  3810|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if elide: args.append('-elide')
  3811|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if count: args.append('-count'); args.append(count)
  3812|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if pattern and pattern[0] == '-': args.append('--')
  3813|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args.append(pattern)
  3814|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        args.append(index)
  3815|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if stopindex: args.append(stopindex)
  3816|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return str(self.tk.call(tuple(args)))
  3817|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3828|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def tag_unbind(self, tagName, sequence, funcid=None):
  3829|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Unbind for all characters with TAGNAME for event SEQUENCE  the
  3830|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        function identified with FUNCID."""
  3831|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(self._w, 'tag', 'bind', tagName, sequence, '')
  3832|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if funcid:
  3833|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.deletecommand(funcid)
  3834|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3835|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def tag_bind(self, tagName, sequence, func, add=None):
  3836|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Bind to all characters with TAGNAME at event SEQUENCE a call to function FUNC.
  3837|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3838|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        An additional boolean parameter ADD specifies whether FUNC will be
  3839|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        called additionally to the other bound function or whether it will
  3840|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        replace the previous function. See bind for the return value."""
  3841|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._bind((self._w, 'tag', 'bind', tagName),
  3842|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                  sequence, func, add)
  3843|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3895|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self._w, 'tag', 'ranges', tagName))

  3932|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class _setit:
  3933|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """Internal class. It wraps the command in the widget OptionMenu."""
  3934|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3935|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, var, value, callback=None):
  3936|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.__value = value
  3937|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.__var = var
  3938|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.__callback = callback
  3939|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3940|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __call__(self, *args):
  3941|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.__var.set(self.__value)
  3942|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if self.__callback:
  3943|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.__callback(self.__value, *args)
  3944|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3946|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class OptionMenu(Menubutton):
  3947|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """OptionMenu which allows the user to select a value from a menu."""
  3948|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3949|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, master, variable, value, *values, **kwargs):
  3950|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Construct an optionmenu widget with the parent MASTER, with
  3951|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the resource textvariable set to VARIABLE, the initially selected
  3952|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        value VALUE, the other menu values VALUES and an additional
  3953|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        keyword argument command."""
  3954|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        kw = {"borderwidth": 2, "textvariable": variable,
  3955|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|              "indicatoron": 1, "relief": RAISED, "anchor": "c",
  3956|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|              "highlightthickness": 2}
  3957|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Widget.__init__(self, master, "menubutton", kw)
  3958|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.widgetName = 'tk_optionMenu'
  3959|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        menu = self.__menu = Menu(self, name="menu", tearoff=0)
  3960|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.menuname = menu._w
  3961|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        # 'command' is the only supported keyword
  3962|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        callback = kwargs.get('command')
  3963|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if 'command' in kwargs:
  3964|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            del kwargs['command']
  3965|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if kwargs:
  3966|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            raise TclError('unknown option -'+kwargs.keys()[0])
  3967|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        menu.add_command(label=value,
  3968|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                 command=_setit(variable, value, callback))
  3969|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        for v in values:
  3970|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            menu.add_command(label=v,
  3971|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                     command=_setit(variable, v, callback))
  3972|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self["menu"] = menu
  3973|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3974|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __getitem__(self, name):
  3975|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if name == 'menu':
  3976|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return self.__menu
  3977|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return Widget.__getitem__(self, name)
  3978|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  3979|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def destroy(self):
  3980|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Destroy this widget and the associated menu."""
  3981|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Menubutton.destroy(self)
  3982|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.__menu = None
  3983|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

  3985|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class Image:

  3989|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, imgtype, name=None, cnf={}, master=None, **kw):
  3990|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.name = None
  3991|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if not master:
  3992|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            master = _default_root
  3993|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if not master:
  3994|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                raise RuntimeError('Too early to create image')
  3995|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk = getattr(master, 'tk', master)
  3996|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if not name:
  3997|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Image._last_id += 1
  3998|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            name = "pyimage%r" % (Image._last_id,) # tk itself would use image<x>
  3999|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if kw and cnf: cnf = _cnfmerge((cnf, kw))
  4000|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        elif kw: cnf = kw
  4001|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        options = ()
  4002|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        for k, v in cnf.items():
  4003|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if callable(v):
  4004|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                v = self._register(v)
  4005|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            options = options + ('-'+k, v)
  4006|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(('image', 'create', imgtype, name,) + options)
  4007|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.name = name

  4017|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                pass

  4030|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                if k[-1] == '_': k = k[:-1]
  4031|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                if callable(v):
  4032|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                    v = self._register(v)
  4033|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                res = res + ('-'+k, v)

  4108|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        position TO, e.g. image.put("{red green} {blue yellow}", to=(4,6))"""

  4187|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def bbox(self, index):
  4188|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return a tuple of X1,Y1,X2,Y2 coordinates for a
  4189|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        rectangle which encloses the character given by index.
  4190|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4191|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The first two elements of the list give the x and y
  4192|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        coordinates of the upper-left corner of the screen
  4193|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        area covered by the character (in pixels relative
  4194|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        to the widget) and the last two elements give the
  4195|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        width and height of the character, in pixels. The
  4196|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        bounding box may refer to a region outside the
  4197|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        visible area of the window.
  4198|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4199|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(self.tk.call(self._w, 'bbox', index)) or None
  4200|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4201|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def delete(self, first, last=None):
  4202|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Delete one or more elements of the spinbox.
  4203|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4204|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        First is the index of the first character to delete,
  4205|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        and last is the index of the character just after
  4206|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the last one to delete. If last isn't specified it
  4207|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        defaults to first+1, i.e. a single character is
  4208|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        deleted.  This command returns an empty string.
  4209|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4210|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, 'delete', first, last)
  4211|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4212|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def get(self):
  4213|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Returns the spinbox's string"""
  4214|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, 'get')
  4215|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4216|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def icursor(self, index):

  4251|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def scan(self, *args):
  4252|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Internal function."""
  4253|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(
  4254|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call((self._w, 'scan') + args)) or ()
  4255|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4256|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def scan_mark(self, x):
  4257|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Records x and the current view in the spinbox window;
  4258|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4259|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        used in conjunction with later scan dragto commands.
  4260|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Typically this command is associated with a mouse button
  4261|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        press in the widget. It returns an empty string.
  4262|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4263|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.scan("mark", x)
  4264|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4265|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def scan_dragto(self, x):
  4266|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Compute the difference between the given x argument
  4267|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        and the x argument to the last scan mark command
  4268|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4269|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        It then adjusts the view left or right by 10 times the
  4270|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        difference in x-coordinates. This command is typically
  4271|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        associated with mouse motion events in the widget, to
  4272|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        produce the effect of dragging the spinbox at high speed
  4273|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        through the window. The return value is an empty string.
  4274|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4275|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.scan("dragto", x)
  4276|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4277|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection(self, *args):
  4278|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Internal function."""
  4279|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(
  4280|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call((self._w, 'selection') + args)) or ()
  4281|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4282|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection_adjust(self, index):
  4283|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Locate the end of the selection nearest to the character
  4284|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        given by index,
  4285|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4286|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Then adjust that end of the selection to be at index
  4287|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        (i.e including but not going beyond index). The other
  4288|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        end of the selection is made the anchor point for future
  4289|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        select to commands. If the selection isn't currently in
  4290|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the spinbox, then a new selection is created to include
  4291|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        the characters between index and the most recent selection
  4292|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        anchor point, inclusive.
  4293|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4294|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.selection("adjust", index)
  4295|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4296|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection_clear(self):
  4297|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Clear the selection
  4298|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4299|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If the selection isn't in this widget then the
  4300|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        command has no effect.
  4301|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4302|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.selection("clear")

  4304|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection_element(self, element=None):

  4312|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection_from(self, index):
  4313|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Set the fixed end of a selection to INDEX."""
  4314|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.selection('from', index)
  4315|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4316|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def selection_present(self):

  4357|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class PanedWindow(Widget):
  4358|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    """panedwindow widget."""
  4359|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4360|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, master=None, cnf={}, **kw):
  4361|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Construct a panedwindow widget with the parent MASTER.
  4362|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4363|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        STANDARD OPTIONS
  4364|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4365|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            background, borderwidth, cursor, height,
  4366|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            orient, relief, width
  4367|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4368|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        WIDGET-SPECIFIC OPTIONS
  4369|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4370|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            handlepad, handlesize, opaqueresize,
  4371|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            sashcursor, sashpad, sashrelief,
  4372|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            sashwidth, showhandle,
  4373|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4374|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Widget.__init__(self, master, 'panedwindow', cnf, kw)
  4375|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4376|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def add(self, child, **kw):
  4377|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Add a child widget to the panedwindow in a new pane.
  4378|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4379|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        The child argument is the name of the child widget
  4380|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        followed by pairs of arguments that specify how to
  4381|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        manage the windows. The possible options and values
  4382|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        are the ones accepted by the paneconfigure method.
  4383|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4384|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call((self._w, 'add', child) + self._options(kw))
  4385|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4386|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def remove(self, child):
  4387|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Remove the pane containing child from the panedwindow
  4388|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4389|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        All geometry management options for child will be forgotten.
  4390|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4391|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call(self._w, 'forget', child)
  4392|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4393|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    forget = remove
  4394|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4395|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def identify(self, x, y):
  4396|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Identify the panedwindow component at point x, y
  4397|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4398|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If the point is over a sash or a sash handle, the result
  4399|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        is a two element list containing the index of the sash or
  4400|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        handle, and a word indicating whether it is over a sash
  4401|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        or a handle, such as {0 sash} or {2 handle}. If the point
  4402|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        is over any other part of the panedwindow, the result is
  4403|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        an empty list.
  4404|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4405|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.tk.call(self._w, 'identify', x, y)
  4406|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4407|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def proxy(self, *args):
  4408|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Internal function."""
  4409|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(
  4410|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call((self._w, 'proxy') + args)) or ()
  4411|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4412|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def proxy_coord(self):
  4413|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return the x and y pair of the most recent proxy location
  4414|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4415|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.proxy("coord")
  4416|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4417|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def proxy_forget(self):
  4418|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Remove the proxy from the display.
  4419|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4420|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.proxy("forget")
  4421|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4422|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def proxy_place(self, x, y):
  4423|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Place the proxy at the given x and y coordinates.
  4424|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4425|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.proxy("place", x, y)
  4426|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4427|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def sash(self, *args):
  4428|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Internal function."""
  4429|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self._getints(
  4430|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.tk.call((self._w, 'sash') + args)) or ()
  4431|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4432|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def sash_coord(self, index):
  4433|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Return the current x and y pair for the sash given by index.
  4434|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4435|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        Index must be an integer between 0 and 1 less than the
  4436|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        number of panes in the panedwindow. The coordinates given are
  4437|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        those of the top left corner of the region containing the sash.
  4438|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        pathName sash dragto index x y This command computes the
  4439|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        difference between the given coordinates and the coordinates
  4440|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        given to the last sash coord command for the given sash. It then
  4441|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        moves that sash the computed difference. The return value is the
  4442|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        empty string.
  4443|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4444|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        return self.sash("coord", index)

  4464|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            (self._w, 'panecget') + (child, '-'+option))
  4465|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4466|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def paneconfigure(self, tagOrId, cnf=None, **kw):
  4467|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Query or modify the management options for window.
  4468|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4469|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        If no option is specified, returns a list describing all
  4470|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        of the available options for pathName.  If option is
  4471|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        specified with no value, then the command returns a list
  4472|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        describing the one named option (this list will be identical
  4473|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        to the corresponding sublist of the value returned if no
  4474|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        option is specified). If one or more option-value pairs are
  4475|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        specified, then the command modifies the given widget
  4476|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        option(s) to have the given value(s); in this case the
  4477|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        command returns an empty string. The following options
  4478|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        are supported:
  4479|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4480|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        after window
  4481|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Insert the window after the window specified. window
  4482|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            should be the name of a window already managed by pathName.
  4483|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        before window
  4484|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Insert the window before the window specified. window
  4485|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            should be the name of a window already managed by pathName.
  4486|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        height size
  4487|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Specify a height for the window. The height will be the
  4488|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            outer dimension of the window including its border, if
  4489|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            any. If size is an empty string, or if -height is not
  4490|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            specified, then the height requested internally by the
  4491|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            window will be used initially; the height may later be
  4492|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            adjusted by the movement of sashes in the panedwindow.
  4493|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Size may be any value accepted by Tk_GetPixels.
  4494|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        minsize n
  4495|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Specifies that the size of the window cannot be made
  4496|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            less than n. This constraint only affects the size of
  4497|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            the widget in the paned dimension -- the x dimension
  4498|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            for horizontal panedwindows, the y dimension for
  4499|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            vertical panedwindows. May be any value accepted by
  4500|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Tk_GetPixels.
  4501|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        padx n
  4502|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Specifies a non-negative value indicating how much
  4503|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            extra space to leave on each side of the window in
  4504|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            the X-direction. The value may have any of the forms
  4505|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            accepted by Tk_GetPixels.
  4506|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        pady n
  4507|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Specifies a non-negative value indicating how much
  4508|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            extra space to leave on each side of the window in
  4509|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            the Y-direction. The value may have any of the forms
  4510|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            accepted by Tk_GetPixels.
  4511|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        sticky style
  4512|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            If a window's pane is larger than the requested
  4513|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            dimensions of the window, this option may be used
  4514|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            to position (or stretch) the window within its pane.
  4515|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Style is a string that contains zero or more of the
  4516|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            characters n, s, e or w. The string can optionally
  4517|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            contains spaces or commas, but they are ignored. Each
  4518|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            letter refers to a side (north, south, east, or west)
  4519|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            that the window will "stick" to. If both n and s
  4520|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            (or e and w) are specified, the window will be
  4521|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            stretched to fill the entire height (or width) of
  4522|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            its cavity.
  4523|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        width size
  4524|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Specify a width for the window. The width will be
  4525|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            the outer dimension of the window including its
  4526|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            border, if any. If size is an empty string, or
  4527|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            if -width is not specified, then the width requested
  4528|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            internally by the window will be used initially; the
  4529|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            width may later be adjusted by the movement of sashes
  4530|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            in the panedwindow. Size may be any value accepted by
  4531|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            Tk_GetPixels.
  4532|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4533|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
  4534|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if cnf is None and not kw:
  4535|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return self._getconfigure(self._w, 'paneconfigure', tagOrId)
  4536|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if isinstance(cnf, str) and not kw:
  4537|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return self._getconfigure1(
  4538|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                self._w, 'paneconfigure', tagOrId, '-'+cnf)
  4539|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self.tk.call((self._w, 'paneconfigure', tagOrId) +
  4540|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|                 self._options(cnf, kw))
  4541|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
  4542|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    paneconfig = paneconfigure

   125|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|class Listener(ListenerMixin, _base.Listener):
   126|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    #: The Windows hook ID for low level mouse events, ``WH_MOUSE_LL``
   127|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    _EVENTS = 14
   128|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   129|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    WM_LBUTTONDOWN = 0x0201
   130|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    WM_LBUTTONUP = 0x0202
   131|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    WM_MBUTTONDOWN = 0x0207

   138|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   139|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    #: A mapping from messages to button events
   140|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    CLICK_BUTTONS = {
   141|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        WM_LBUTTONDOWN: (Button.left, True),

   147|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|

   156|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    class _MSLLHOOKSTRUCT(ctypes.Structure):
   157|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """Contains information about a mouse event passed to a ``WH_MOUSE_LL``
   158|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        hook procedure, ``MouseProc``.
   159|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        """
   160|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        _fields_ = [
   161|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            ('pt', wintypes.POINT),
   162|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            ('mouseData', wintypes.DWORD),
   163|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            ('flags', wintypes.DWORD),
   164|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            ('time', wintypes.DWORD),
   165|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            ('dwExtraInfo', ctypes.c_void_p)]
   166|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   167|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    #: A pointer to a :class:`_MSLLHOOKSTRUCT`
   168|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    _LPMSLLHOOKSTRUCT = ctypes.POINTER(_MSLLHOOKSTRUCT)
   169|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   170|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
   171|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        super(Listener, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
   172|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        self._event_filter = self._options.get(
   173|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            'event_filter',
   174|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            lambda msg, data: True)
   175|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   176|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def _handle(self, code, msg, lpdata):
   177|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if code != SystemHook.HC_ACTION:
   178|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return
   179|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   180|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        data = ctypes.cast(lpdata, self._LPMSLLHOOKSTRUCT).contents
   181|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   182|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        # Suppress further propagation of the event if it is filtered
   183|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if self._event_filter(msg, data) is False:
   184|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            return
   185|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   186|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        if msg == self.WM_MOUSEMOVE:
   187|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.on_move(data.pt.x, data.pt.y)
   188|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   189|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        elif msg in self.CLICK_BUTTONS:
   190|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            button, pressed = self.CLICK_BUTTONS[msg]
   191|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.on_click(data.pt.x, data.pt.y, button, pressed)
   192|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
   193|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        elif msg in self.SCROLL_BUTTONS:
   194|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            mx, my = self.SCROLL_BUTTONS[msg]
   195|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            dd = wintypes.SHORT(data.mouseData >> 16).value // WHEEL_DELTA
   196|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.on_scroll(data.pt.x, data.pt.y, dd * mx, dd * my)

   266|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|    def enter(self, state):
   267|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|        try:  # l'exception sert  ignorer si l'utilisateur entre une valeur absurde.
   268|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            value = int(self.get())
   269|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|            self.delete(0, tk.END)

    82|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|#---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    83|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|#
    84|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# Default levels and level names, these can be replaced with any positive set
    85|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# of values having corresponding names. There is a pseudo-level, NOTSET, which
    86|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# is only really there as a lower limit for user-defined levels. Handlers and
    87|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# loggers are initialized with NOTSET so that they will log all messages, even
    88|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|# at user-defined levels.
    89|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|#
    90|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|
    91|         0|            0|            0|  0.00%|CRITICAL = 50
